Key Match Events: Seth Lugo threw seven solid innings, allowing one run on six hits with nine strikeouts.
James McArthur allowed a walk-off double to Jose Altuve in Kansas City’s 3-2 loss.
Framber Valdez threw seven no-hit innings for the Astros.
Kyle Isbel broke up the possible combined no-hitter with a single through the left side off Bryan Abreu with two outs in the eighth.
Paul DeJong tied the game at 2 with a two-run homer into the Crawford Boxes off Josh Hader with one out in the ninth.
Post-Match Reflections: Royals manager Matt Quatraro praised Seth Lugo's performance, saying 'He was exceptional. Spun the ball really well, located. He got his sinker in, [threw] good changeups. He had it all working. Seven innings of one-run baseball against that team is a phenomenal effort.'
Seth Lugo credited his preparation between starts for his performance, saying 'I was working on some stuff. I was trying to make an adjustment to put together more quality innings.'

Paul DeJong reflected on his game-tying home run, saying 'He’s been tying me up in, especially up and in with that fastball. He left a slider out there in the middle, kind of low. It was right where I wanted something. I didn’t hit it great, but I got enough of it.'
Despite the tough loss and the news that first baseman Vinnie Pasquantino would be out six to eight weeks with a broken thumb, the Royals showed resolve to fight.
